examined from the coast of Australia I have only met with
those represented in Figs 1.3.7, and two or three others; the
remarkable specimen delineated in Figs 2.4.5 occurred with
another less peculiar among a comparatively <s>n</s> small number
of Orbitolites collected by M Cu<s>m</s>ming in the Philippine
seas; but in a small collection which I have inspected
from the Aegean Sea, the monstrosities of this kind were so
numerous that one specimen out of every 3 or 4 presented some excess [Note  This is by no means a solitary case of the prevalence of monstrosities in particular
localities. The collection of M. Bean of Scarborough contains
a number of curiously distorted specimens of the common
<u>Planorbis <s>lactea</s> marginatus</u>, which have all been collected in one [<s>[?]</s> rook?]_
Their peculiarities are by no means repetitions of each other;
and I am disposed, therefore, <s>more disposed</s> to regard them as rather
resulting from the influence of external conditions, than as
accidental varieties hereditarily propogated] ___
